newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street stocks bruised, see broad-based slump.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street stocks bruised, see broad-based slump.

text.p: Wall Street stocks were weak in afternoon trading on Friday, failing to make much headway against a heavy dose of profit-taking which erased many of the week's exuberant gains.
The Dow Jones Industrial average was down around 96 points, or 1.18 percent, to 7924.
Stocks tumbled after a Microsoft Corp earnings report triggered selling in the technology sector, which then spread to other areas, analysts said.
The Nasdaq composite was down 19 points at 1549.
The long bond was down 10/32 at 6.51 percent.
